name: Hotel Stratford

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for five days and found it to be a wonderful experience. As noted by the reviews the room was indeed small but adequate for our needs as we were only in the room to sleep. We had no problem with street noise and slept with the window open. The staff was very helpful with any questions we had and very knowledgeable about the area. We loved the convenience of the hotel and would hightly recommend it to anyone. Also, we loved the breakfast in the AM. We thought it was quite adequate for our needs. We would definitely stay here again on our next trip to San Francisco.
reviews.title: Wonderful experience at the Stratford

reviews.text: We had six people and this is one of few hotels that could hold six people without booking two rooms. It is right on the cablecar line which was fun for the kids (ages 15 - 21). No air conditioning and it did get a little hot. The hotel was noisy with some guest fighting in the middle of the night (two nights in a row) the outside is noisy and since the windows needed to be open,this was an issue with the kids in the front...it was a clean hotel, nice staff, convenient to everything..location location...it was fun to be where were for the price!! I would book that again if I needed that much space.
reviews.title: Great Value, Great Location..Noisy
Would definitely stay here again
reviews.text: Debbie from Cincinnati Ohio

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Sratford Hotel is in the heart of San Fransico, minutes from transport to places such as Fishermans Wharf, Pier 39 and a train to the airport. The rooms are small but very clean and pleasant to stay in. We were on the 4th floor which meant noise of traffic was minimal. Very pleased with the breakfast selection. The lift was slow but there are stairs if you are in a hurray. Staff were helpful and friendly. I loved being able to step out of the hotel and be right in the centre of town - shops, Union Square, cable car etc. I would definitely stay here again but possibly avoid a weekend as prices rise considerably.
reviews.title: Very Happy Customer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I arrived on the 4th of July in the afternoon and were greeted very warmly by the staff. As soon as we got to our room (we were very happy to have a view of the street) we took off to explore. We found that our hotel is located just half a block from Union Square and just 2 blocks from where the cable car turns around. So not only is The Stratford located very close to so many of the things we wanted to see but it is a wonderful hotel. The free morning breakfast is just the healthy food we needed to start our day. The room has a very nice bathroom and is very clean and well laid out. We were unable to do and see all the things we wanted to so when we come back to San Francisco we will without a doubt be staying at The Stratford and I will also be recommending this hotel to anybody I know making the same trip.
reviews.title: Perfectly suitable for short break

reviews.text: First let me say, I was traveling on a budget and alone! I found this hotel on hotels.com for approximately $100.00 per night. I checked other reviews here on TripAdvisor and decided to go for it. I was pleasantly surprised. The staff was very accomodating in finding me a room that was in a main hallway so that I would feel comfortable in the fact that I was a female traveling alone. The breakfast that was included was not gourmet, but certainly a luxury that we Americans do not see very often. The room was very clean. Yes, it was small and the comforter wasn't down filled, but you should expect that if you are paying $100.00 a night.
reviews.title: Great Value

likes.disliked: — The comforter on the bed was a little old.

reviews.text: The decor' of the lobby and the sitting area was nice. There were three computers and a printer available with a swipe of a card. I found this particularly convenient the day I was leaving. I was able to check-in online for my flight and print my boarding pass. Finally...I was right around the corner from Union Square and plenty of desireable restaurants. I would recommend this hotel to anyone that doesn't feel the need to spend $400.00 per night for a room.
reviews.title: Not Impressed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although the location is great if you want to be by Union Square, and the rates may be competitive, I was not happy with my stay. I stayed 1 night on business (try the Chencellor Hotel for comparable value but much better service). Was supposed to be at the Adante Hotel but they were booked and sent me to their "sister hotel", the Stratford (thankfully! The Adante is not close at all to Union Square and is in much seedier part of the neighborhood).
reviews.title: Good Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - I didn't find the staff that helpful or friendly; too busy to acknowledge me at the desk; had to wait to get my suitcase from the luggage storage; got attitude whan I asked them to hunt down the guy with the keys so I could catch my plane.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - My TV did not work; the clock radio did not work; the sink (in the bedroom) leaked; no ironing board in the room; didn't allow early check-in or late check-out (I can live with this becasue they were booked up, but fit trend of being inflexible and not too concerned about customer service); elevator does take forever; no free WiFi (Tip: Union Square has free public WiFi); no A/C, which in San Fran is okay, but no ceiiling fan in the room).
reviews.title: Excellent value
Loved It!
reviews.text: 06/29/07 - I stayed at this hotel back in Feb. '05. It was the first time that I went to San Fran. The reason I booked at this hotel, was because of the price and location. I made a good choice. The rooms are little on the smaller side, but you are not going to San Fran to stay in your room. The rooms were very nice. A lot of shopping, restaurant, bars and a mall nearby. The staff was very kind and friendly and this is the reason I'm booking at this hotel when I go to San Fran in september. Thank You Stratford Hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great place... read review just prior to this one and he says it all very well.... was there in April 2007 ... 2nd time in SF/Union square in past year.....
reviews.title: GREAT...

likes.disliked: — rooms are very small but whatever.......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: TIP: This hotel is affordable enough to just book it outright.... NOT worth playing games on HOTWIRE to get a "Union Square" hotel for $30 less b/c it can very shady very quickly ....
reviews.title: Everything you need

likes.liked: — The location, the price, and the style

reviews.title: Great Location - Room adequate
reviews.text: The Powell is another nice affordable choice w/slightly bigger rooms... but overall the location, nice breakfast and value of the STRATFORD i will def go back there next time in SF....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I stayed at The Stratford for one night in May, a Thursday. Arriving into the Oakland airport late (11:30), we had no trouble finding the hotel and checking in.
reviews.title: About as central as you can get

reviews.text: The location is very good, if a little claustrophobic, being right on Powell Street at Union Square.
reviews.title: If only the room wasn't so cold...

reviews.text: The Queen-bed room I stayed in was pretty small but I can cope with that.
reviews.title: Perfect Location & Price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My main gripe was that there is no individually controlled heating or aircon in the room. While the heating is on, the room is fine, but *they switch the heating off* at about 8.30pm every evening! So it got very cold after that. I don't know when the heating comes on again but it certainly wasn't before 9.30am when I left the hotel each morning.
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location

likes.liked: — Location, Location, Location, Price, Price, Price

reviews.title: Perfect Vacation
reviews.text: Breakfast is included in the price and was OK: muffins, pastries, toast, cereal and the like; but not much choice and it was exactly the same every day, so you may get bored of it quite quickly.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had no problems with the Stratford. Fabulous location, right in the heart of Union Square, 2 minute walk to Macy's and all the great shops. Cable car stop right outside the hotel entrance. Perfect place to stay if no transport as Fishermans Wharf accessible by cable and walk to Union Square.
reviews.title: Incompetent mgmt, great location

likes.disliked: — Lack of heat or fire alarm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Being a travel agent and having stayed all over the world, my standards can be a little unreasonable. However, I have been looking into value hotels for clients that want to stop over in San Jose. This will now be the place I recommend for those on a budget! The room was very clean, the bed very comfortable, and you can't beat the price. Very good location!
reviews.title: An absolute wonderful suprise!!!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I usually stay here to "get away". The service is always great the rooms and clean - and the manager Doreen Chavarria is always so pleasant and helpful. Recommend this place to anyone for the comfort service and great location to food and attractions.
reviews.title: Great location comfortable rooms and great service

reviews.text: I had to move out of my house due to a serious leak , after a very bad early rain. My contractor wanted do everything in one day and night. So I was looking for a every inexpensive spot to stay for 2 nights. A friend of mime referred me to the hotel since it was near my Auntie, who I was going to visit for the day. The hotel was making renovations, they had just finished painting the outside and were putting in new windows. The front desk was so nice and excitied about the changes and upgrades to the hotel. It was very quiet in the morning and the contiental breakfast had pretty good coffee.
reviews.title: Pleasant surprise

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel and was very happy. The front desk was very helpful with directions,the rooms were clean and looked like it had been newly remodled. I especially liked the flat panel t.v The breakfast was delicious with so many choices. I will be coming back here again!!!
reviews.title: Very nice place to stay, great accommocations!

reviews.text: I thought Howard Johnson hotels were supposed to be somewhat clean and nice--it looked like a cruddy time warp from the 70s. Yuck. We booked this for an overnight stay after going to a sporting event. The air conditioner was broken-did not work at all-the room seemed old and dirty. When we first walked in the room all I could think was, "I don't want to sleep in that icky bed". Bedspread was disgusting had cigarette burns in it & carpet seemed dirty. Sink was outside of the bathroom so we all had to watch each other brush our teeth and stuff. They said they had wi-fi but they didn't. I usually give business owners the benefit of the doubt, but this place is really really scummy and there seemed to be lots of other places around--I would recommend going to one of those others.
reviews.title: Nasty--Like going to the third world without leaving the USA!

reviews.text: Booked this hotel purely on the reviews I read on here and wasn't disappointed. There seemed to be A LOT of bad hotel reviews for San Fran.
reviews.title: Great location, good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reception desk staff very polite and keen to help.
reviews.title: location, location, location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lift very slow, but we were on the 7th floor so persevered with it!
reviews.title: cute place...great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a twin bed room which was quite spacious although not much room for 2 large suitcases.
reviews.title: Great for tourists...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We we at the front of the hotel so was quite noisy, if i stayed again, which i would, i'd request a room at the back. Slept well despite this.
reviews.title: I was taken by the stratford hotel!

likes.liked: — It was a very old bilding.
likes.disliked: — They cheated me out of money, and there breckfest.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros: it was in the heart of S.F. literally everything is in walking distance, and if you need to go far, you can take the ferry that is right outside your steps, it goes all the way down to fisherman's wharf/Alcatraz.
reviews.title: If you rely on Location this IS the spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cons: We stayed in the standard queen room and it looks like the 360 degree video on thier website, very small. But if you just need it for sleep the bed was comfortable, shower worked and they had free breakfast. Parking is $25 for every 24 hours in and out. which really sucks, but reality is pretty much every hotel you stay at in S.F. you have to pay for parking, mind you that if you do drive your car anywhere, you have to pay for parking, some places are $3 an hour, but usually it's a base fee of $10 with a maximum of like 4 hours.. soo lame, so you are better off flying there, then using the trolly, walking, or taking a cab, especially if you're not used to the roads there cuz it is craaaazy.
reviews.title: Great little place

reviews.text: overall the hotel is a good place to go if you are going for the sights of S.F. if you are trying to do a romantic getaway with a luxury hotel this is def not the place for you
reviews.title: Great value!

reviews.text: This a small boutique hotel in a great location.
reviews.title: Cheap and cheerful

reviews.text: The Stratford is right on Powell Street. Down the bottom of the street is the cable car turn-around - which takes you to fisherman's wharf. Warning: the lines here are HUGE. If you walk up the hill a bit, you can usually jump on on a car fairly easily.
reviews.title: Great bargain & great location!!

reviews.text: We opted to stay here instead of in a "hotel" and am for the price it was a great stay. We checked in after midnight and the gal in the office was most helpful. If we ever travel that way again, I would stay again.
reviews.title: Great place for travelers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just needed a room for the night before our flight out the next day. This hotel was just fine. The room was spacious and clean. The place was quiet and we slept well. Breakfast was your typical one for this tier hotel, but with the nice addition of fresh bananas and hard-boiled eggs. Only one caveat -- we did not see a good place to eat supper and the neighborhood seemed a bit run down. We had a bottle of wine with us and ordered pizza, so all was fine, however. I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Need a room near the airport? -- This is a good choice.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Staff GREAT! check in fast and room NICE! free internet! comfy BIG BED! close to a lot of stores! me n the hubby wanted to get away from the kids and have some quite time. But needed to stay close this was PERFECT we will be back. : )
reviews.title: Time Away !

reviews.text: my first visit and i have stayed at other Silicon Valley lodging places. within its category (2 star) it is fine. if you are on a budget, this should be your place.
reviews.title: within its category, i found it is a 7.5 out of 10

reviews.text: not a hotel, a two story motel but exterior clearly remodeled and interior neat and apparently remodeled, including new wall heating/cooling system.
reviews.title: Excellent for business trips

reviews.text: Nice place to stay, conveniently located (Union Square). cheap and clean.
reviews.title: Nice Place to stay

reviews.text: The Stratford cannot be beaten for location. The cable car stops right outside the door, there is a great deli just across the street and union square is just around the corner.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: The hotel itself is just what you need when you are on a break in a city like San Francisco. It is a budget hotel but the rooms are clean and perfectly roomy, breakfast is included in your rate and the front desk is available 24/7. If you want 5 star luxury in a city like San Francisco then you must be planning to spend a lot of time in your room.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: We were looking for a pleasant hotel to use as a base for our family holiday and thats exactly what we got.
reviews.title: Not so great..

reviews.text: We would recommend the hotel to anyone wanting the same and as for the noise of the cable cars, they stop at midnight. And if you want to get some sleep any earlier earplugs are provided. My two teenagers slept in the street facing bedroom and had no problems with noise and they thought the earplugs were just another wacky american notion (thats irish teenagers for you.)
reviews.title: Small, friendly, excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here at the end of November for our second visit to San Francisco, the first time having stayed with friends. The location of this hotel might suit some people who want to be in the centre of the city (its on a nosy main street around the corner from Union Square) but we found the noise at night really annoying and it kept us awake. We stayed on the eight floor and our room was tiny! The beds felt smaller than single beds and were not comfortable at all. The room was absolutely freezing and when we phoned the fromt desk to ask how to get the radiator to work we were told that it is on a main timer at the hotel and they could not turn it on for us! The radiator never worked at all for the course of our trip and we were absolutely frozen! The cleanliness of the room was fine and the staff on the front desk were pleasant but I would not stay here again or recommend it to anyone. In my opinion you could get a much nicer hotel for what we paid with Expedia.
reviews.title: Wouldn't stay here again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a Queen on the 8th floor, away from Powell, which had no view but was reasonably quiet when the windows were shut.
reviews.title: Good hotel for the price

reviews.text: The room layout was a bit awkward as the sink was not in the bathroom but the bedroom area. The room was clean except for some scuff marks on the wall. The room had a slightly humid feel to it
reviews.title: Stay Near The Square - In The Middle Of It All

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a free continental breakfast, which includes muffins, cereal , toast and coffee/tea.
reviews.title: Loud Street Noise, No AC

likes.liked: — Low price, two blocks from BART station, one block from Union Square
likes.disliked: — Very loud street noise, very hot, small room, low budget remodel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel has excellent access to public transportation around the city and to the airport. Unfortunately the hotel elevator is rather slow.
reviews.title: Excellent Location

reviews.text: It was obvious why this was one of the cheapest hotels in the area. I booked a room with one bed but they gave me one with two. The lady at the checkin specified to only use one bed. The towels had red or brown stains on them - luckily I had my own towel with me and didn't want to speculate about what caused the stains. The blanket on the bed looked like it had been donated by Goodwill. The "free breakfast" was old donuts and cereal with "take only one item" signs on them. The shampoo bottle was sealed with tape, obviously partially used and refilled, and I'm not sure if it really was shampoo. The room smelled weird. Spend a couple dollars more and stay somewhere else.
reviews.title: Stained towels and refilled shampoo bottles

likes.liked: — The parking lot was close to the room

reviews.text: The innkeeper is a nice man. He is a joker, jokes about everything. So don't take his words so seriously. He's helpful too.
Rooms are ok. The wireless internet access is very weak, so do request for an ethernet cable and plug into the wall.
reviews.title: OK place to stay.....
Not recommended
reviews.text: Location is quite good! 15mins drive to airport, bus 22 to Santa Clara Caltrain station (10mins) and downtown (20mins).

My sister made the reservation and asked for a quiet room. IOur room was in the middle of the hotel and didn't have a view . However, even though it was on Powell street with cable cars, we couldn't hear anything. Europeans were the main guests. The beds were comfortable and the breakfast room was pleasant.
reviews.title: Small but Quiet room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you want to be close to everything in SF this is the place.
reviews.title: Heart of Downtown S.F.

reviews.text: This is the downtown hotel, the room was small, very small but for the location we did not care at all. The view of our room was the back of the hotel but hey we did not care at all.
reviews.title: Do not chose a club room !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was great and helped us alot.
reviews.title: Good Hotel for what we needed
The Return
reviews.text: We were walking distance of the powell train station, the cable car ( arrive early huge line up) or just take the tram to Fisherman's wharf, its faster and more convenient.

It's been said before here, but I'll say it again...if you're after luxury, go elsewhere. It's a basic place, clean, with an OK breakfast...most important, the central location. It's right where you want to be for everything.
reviews.title: A fair enough place for the price

likes.disliked: — Being double charged, however I did get my money back

reviews.text: We booked through expedia so paid through them, however upon returning home I found that my card had been charged again. I thought this may be a problem, however I got all my money back.
reviews.title: Don't bother to go here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's not going to be the Waldorf, but you want to be out experiencing the city, not lounging around in the hotel.
reviews.title: Horrible, rude and cramped

reviews.text: I give it 4 stars because of the price and location, and the fact that it was clean and in a safe area.
reviews.title: Fantastic Location, not so fantastic hotel

likes.disliked: — The room... small and hot - no ventilation. Air-con would have made the room a lot better.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The last days of our road trip through California we stayed in this hotel. I can't recommend it. The rooms are tiny, noisy and I believe the price isn't that marvellous as well (you can find better deals!) If you stay in SF I highly recommend The Monticello Hotel (only one black more to Powell Station). I stayed there the first nights which was simply marvellous. Fine, large rooms, breakfast and complimentary wine in the afternoon and free internet! Clean & crisp. So do'n bother with the Stratford and find an other deal!
reviews.title: Pefect for travelers on a BUDGET who don't want a DIVE hotel!
False Advertising
reviews.text: My daughter and I stayed at The Stratford Hotel last week for two nights. While the location is wonderful and the staff polite, there were problems. Our room smelled strongly of chlorine when we arrived, and the carpet was moist and moldy. We had to have the window open all night, but still my daughter had asthma attacks both nights. The lights went out in the bathroom and over the sink (circuit breaker?) twice. The bottled waters for sale for $4. were insulting. We went out the second morning, returning at 10:30 to collect our luggage and check out. Our door wouldn't open. When we asked we were told that our keys must have been de-magnetized. Very annoying to be locked out before check-out.

reviews.title: Okay #2
reviews.text: The worst disappointment was breakfast. On the website the picture shows tablecloths, baskets of fruit and assorted rolls, etc.- a very lovely-looking meal. It wasn't like that at all. There were loaves of bread still in the wrapper you could toast yourself, over-sweetened granola, day-old muffins, a juice dispenser and self-serve coffee which was often empty. No fresh fruit. No rolls. No tablecloths. Awful.
With better management, this hotel could be a really lovely place to stay in San Francisco. As it is, I doubt we'll return.
reviews.title: Location can't be beat!
Okay
reviews.text: As many reviewers have noted, the Stratford has a great central location. Access to Union Square and and Muni/BART at the Powell Street Station is wonderful. The hotel is also very reasonably priced. I found the staff to be generally friendly and helpful. They got me into my room well before the 3 PM check-in time and kindly allowed me a late checkout. However, I found the house keeping staff to be rather intrusive. I was not quick enough to acknowledge a house keeper's rap at the door while napping and found myself having a dialog with her from my bed. I would have to echo some complaints about smell. This may be due to the strong bleach solution used to clean the bathroom. It took some time to air out. The Hotel should also try to check out the noise made by the bathroom vent fans. Mine sounded like a WWII vintage airplane engine. The location is noisy, particularly for rooms on the Powell Street side of the building. Bring earplugs if you have them. Even the hotel offers them. I had a room somewhat back from Powell Street and was not bothered by the noise. The room was small, clean, and furnished with a comfortable bed, writing desk, and TV. My room had been redone in a simple, straightforward style somewhat reminiscent of Ikea. I found that I did miss having a sitting area. Though, I don't suppose it's an issue if you're going to be out on the town. The rooms are heated by radiators, consequently guests don't have good temperature control. In trying to air out my room, I found that the room became a bit cool. The Hotel advertises wireless internet access which it doesn't have, and it should stop advertising wireless access until it really gets it. I have been assured that it will be coming. There is a Google wifi network that covers Union Square, and it is possible to get a wireless connection there. The Google signal is available if one moves over to the Powell Street side of the building. internet access via desk top computers is available in the back of the main lobby, though seems a bit expensive at $4 for 20 minutes. i would consider staying at the Stratford again, but think I may be willing to pay a bit more for a quieter location, in room WiFi internet access, and more of a sitting area.

reviews.title: Excellent Value
reviews.text: Stayed at the Strattford for 5 nights for a convention, and very satisfied for the price we paid ($80). First of all, the location is great - Convention Ctr. is 4 blocks, 2 blocks to cable car station, BART, and Visitor Ctr. Just off Union Square - great shopping, if that's your thing.

As a travel agent I'm always looking for small properties for clients who are looking for the best price for clean, comfortable lodging. Excellent location between Union Square and Market St., up 1 1/2 blocks from the Powell Street cable car turnaround. All the major shopping within a 5 minute walk. Several good restaurants/cafes locally.
reviews.title: Excellent choice and way above 2 star expectations

reviews.text: Rooms are small (but I wasn't expecting to entertain a group!) and very clean. For the price of around $100 per night, about 1/3 the price of the "big name" hotels nearby. Bed linens and towels were as good as any 4-5 start hotel. The bed was more comfortable than a 4 star resort hotel I'd stayed at a week earlier and at 1/4 the price. Staff at the Stratford was friendly and helpful. Breakfast may not be fancy, but the coffee and juice were good and the muffin/toast choice was sufficient to get me started for the day. If you want to pay a lot for breakfast, go to one of the many establishments nearby. Luggage storage was very handy since I had the red-eye back to Boston at 11 p.m. I've stayed at 2 other nearby 2-3 star hotels and the Stratford has them beat.
reviews.title: Simple budget hotel near Union Square

reviews.text: My preferences are cleanliness, comfort, location. This hotel met all my criteria.
reviews.title: A bit dumpier than I imagined

reviews.text: Great location in San Fran - next to Union Square and right in the middle of the shopping district. Very close to the BART station which came in handy and the cable car stop is right outside the door!
reviews.title: Exactly what we were expecting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a simple, budget like hotel that is clean and good value for what it is. Staff were always helpful. Rooms were small and most have limited views and some street noise but they were clean and had reasonable amenities. The lobby and common areas are also small and the lift is slow (stairs are quicker).
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The first thing that is important to know is this is no hotel, despite the name. This is a two-story, old-school motel, the kind with an exterior stairway (no elevator that I saw), exterior room doors and parking places that front each ground-floor room. Thank goodness we got a second-floor room. That's the only thing that made this place bearable. I would not want to be the poor people below us. As hard as I tried, I could not help causing all kinds of floor creaking as I walked around my room. The room itself was OK, but certainly nothing to write home about, as other reviews here would have you believe (I'm wondering if they were written by employees). It was clean, that is true. But other than that, very basic. It had an old-style bedspread as opposed to comforters you tend to see in modern hotels. Very cheap and minimal toiletries. And we had all kinds of problems with the air conditioner. Not worth the price we paid for it. Would definitely not stay here for more than one night.
reviews.title: Hotel Stratford is no hotel!

reviews.text: This is a fabulous, quality hotel. The rooms are very nice and have an appearance of a fancy hotel suite. Breakfast is standard continental: mini muffins, fruit (apples and oranges), cereal, toast, o.j. and apple juice, instant oatmeal packets and coffee (I don't recall any tea though). The TV is a 30+ inch flat screen with a lot of satellite channels (most of which you will not watch as they are the standard fluff channels found in every TV market) plus a few movie channels. Microwave and fridge in room, marble counter for sink, closet for clothes (and it has a bench for your suitcase). Shower was nice, but the shower head didn't appear to be adjustable in the angle of the head. My only complaint was that the bed was stiff and flat, causing me to keep turning over through out the night due to pressure points on my shoulder and hip. If the bed was better I would stay here again. However, if you are a back or stomach sleeper you probably won't have any issues with the bed and pressure points. Other than that it is a great value motel to stay at and I recommend it to anyone. The room was spacious and quiet--just be aware that the mattress may be too stiff/flat for your sleeping habits (I'm sure it may depend on which room you get as well. I was in 214).
reviews.title: Great Motel, great price, bed not quite as nice though.

reviews.text: Got lucky when I found this place online while delayed and diverted flying back from NC. I was supposed to go to SFO but the only flight they had was to San Jose. I've never flown into this airport and I'm always super concerned about ending up in a hotel that is a) too expensive for my needs; b) dirty; c) scary neighborhood; d) rude staff. Hotel Stratford (rm 203) is freshly painted in desert colors with large crown molding, cleaner than most corporate hotels, plantation shutters, free continental breakfast (bagels, surprise!), microwave and good size fridge in room. Hot shower, Suave soaps and free wifi. Friendly, helpful staff--they are real people folks, so treat them like you would your neighbor & they'll go out of their way to figure out how to help you with your many questions. Happy travels!
reviews.title: Best Value Near San Jose Airport

reviews.text: I found this place through a coupon magazine, which tend to offer deals on two star (or less) motels. The Hotel Stratford was a big, big surprise. The room sparked and was extremely clean. Everything looked new. Satellite/flat screen TV. Continental breakfast. Quiet, well sound insulated rooms. Helpful, courteous staff. I would definitely recomment this motel to both business and leisure travelers.
reviews.title: Gem in the heart of Silicon Valley

reviews.text: This place is perfect for travelers I arrived late at night and Rena checked me in with a huge smile on her face, that makes my whole trip I arrived from a 8 hrs trip and no smile in any place but she was happy all the time and make ne feel welcome I must say I had a couple friends staying at the Biltmore they complain on everything so I told them to stay here, the hotel has cont breakfast really good clean and lcd HD TV great for the star rating they have, I will come back and will keep recommending this hotel
reviews.title: Mor than what I thought

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Stratford in August 2008 for four days. the hotel is right in the middle of the action in San Fran which made it very convenient to come back during the day. The lift was very slow and is probably easier to take the stairs. The rooms ARE very small, not much room for your suitcases but as we didn't spend too much time in our room, it wasn't much of a concern. we had a room facing away from the street but could still hear the bells from the street cars. Nothing to keep you awake though. reception was helpful and the cleaning was great. bathroom also very tiny, Breakfast was simple and as most american food full of sugar. stay away from the cereal and stick to the toast. juice also was full of sugar. mufffins were good to take for mid morning snack!
reviews.title: Perfect location for everything In San Fran

reviews.text: We ate at Cafe Mason for dinner, simple pasta and quick service. Also Lori's across the road was a great place for lunch. their chicken noodle salad was good as were their waffles.
reviews.title: great location

reviews.text: good value for right in the middle of the city, at the door you can!! take a street car straight to Fishermans Wharf
reviews.title: Great location!
Where you want to be
reviews.text: The Location is the best thing with this hotell, though cleaning was nice.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotell is old, smal no air con- but nice reception.
reviews.title: Great location, hard bed, small room
Excellent Location and Value
reviews.text: This was the first hotel my friend and I stayed at when we arrived for a two week holiday in San Francisco. You can not beat it's location especially if you are new to the area it is right on Powell street next to shops, transport links, restaurants etc. We had a room at the back of the hotel as well as on the end of a row. After reading past reviews of the hotel we weren't expecting much and we knew we hadn't paid a huge amount; however we were pleasantly surprise the room was plenty big enough and had a decent size bathroom. The sink was in the main room with a nice mirror and space to store your toiletries.
The breakfast was a nice touch and we filled ourselves up on toast, muffins, cereal etc. If you don't fancy this there are plenty of options for other food close by.
reviews.title: Hated Stratford
Worried for nothing
reviews.text: As I mentioned the location is excellent right by the shopping centre, Macy's and the lovely Union Square is a few strides away.
We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful; even making a phone calls to our tour providers to sort out some problems we were having.
reviews.title: Great budget stay
Basic But Ideal
reviews.text: There is a small lounge on the ground floor at the back as well as two computers where for a small charge you can access the internet.

reviews.title: Small Room but GREAT location!
reviews.text: Me and my hubby were on our honeymoon to the US and SF was our first stop. We stayed at the Stratford from 15 - 17 March 06 and were very satisfied with our experience. The room was the smallest hotel room we've ever stayed in and there was no view to speak of (just the walls of the neighbouring buiilding), but the location can't be beat.
We arrived at 9am and paid an additional US$10 for an early check-in. We terribly needed a shower after our 20hr flight, hence US$10 seemed reasonable.
reviews.title: Ideal location

reviews.text: A friend and I stayed here for a few nights in January. Its in an excellent location, close to everything. Although the room was very small (two twin beds), it was clean and had a good bathroom. Not alot of natural light as the room's window looked out on to a brick wall - pretty claustrophobic!
reviews.title: Enjoyable stay!

reviews.text: Included breakfast is a bonus...overall good stay, highly rec!
reviews.title: Fabulous Location

reviews.text: My check in was not the best experience. The girl finished her conversation with the bell man, before acknowledging me.
reviews.title: Sufficient and convenient

reviews.text: However, all my dealings with hotel staff after that where pleasant and friendly.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room is small, with an emphasise on small, yet, it was clean and comfortable. I am a petite female and I found the room small, had a bed and that’s it.
reviews.title: Very convenient

description: If travelers were to pinpoint on a map the number one location in San Francisco, it could be right outside the door of Hotel Stratford. Our entrance has become part of thousands of photographs taken of the Cable Car as it heads up the second block of its famous journey over San Francisco's beautiful hillside communities.Guests who want the convenience of being right in the center of the City will enjoy their stay in this European style affordably priced property, with over 80 pleasantly decorated rooms, all with the most modern facilities. We await the pleasure of your company be it for Business or Leisure.
